intro: Mecodium recurvum, commonly known as the slender mecodium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and slender stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Mecodium recurvum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display and compact size.
